intro: Allantodia oligantha, commonly known as the slender allantodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Allantodia oligantha is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
